answers.answer: Hi,I am not sure if your symptoms are from an Endocrine disorder, but there a few things that should be checked.In regard to the chem panel, as long as you fasted for atleast 8 hours, it should not really make a difference what you ate in terms of catching a low level. Sugars in the 80's are not likely the cause of your symptoms, unless you dropped from a much higher number(like 180) and you feel badly because of the drop.A few endocrine causes should be checked out if they have not already: thyroid disease(hyper and hypo) as well as adrenal insufficiency and testosterone levels. It is rare, but you should also be checked for a pheochromocytoma, esp if you have high blood pressure. Talk to your doctor about those. If they are all okay, and you also have an oral glucose tolerance test that is completely normal, then it is less likely to be an endocrine problem. But this is a good start.Take care.

I should also mention something else...I used to exercise alot, I tried to exercise for 20 mins at a pulse rate of 160...I did fine, felt no worse,  but afterwards for about  2 days I   CRASHED AND BURNED.   My symptoms were very bad then, I was dizzy and all other sypmtoms were magnified
